info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 3 at 3:43PM CDT by NWS Louisville KY
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky...
Rough River near Dundee affecting Ohio County.
.Heavy rain from the past 36 hours has caused the river to rise.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Rough River near Dundee.
* WHEN...Until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, Trailer courts in Hartford flood. At 29.0 feet, KY 136 at Heflin Road floods near county line. KY 69 floods near intersection of US 231 in Hartford. At 30.0 feet, US 231 floods at shopping center between Hartford and Beaver Dam.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 25.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 23.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:00 PM CDT Thursday was 25.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 28.7 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall early Saturday afternoon. It will rise to 29.4 feet Sunday evening. It will then fall Monday evening. It will rise to 28.5 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 28.1 feet on 06/29/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk.
The next statement will be issued by Friday afternoon at 100 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
